starts.title: Both players make faces at each other
Both players make up a bizarre dance

examples.title: Both players speak only in gibberish for 10 seconds
examples.extra: Add interpretive dance to express your point

examples.title: Both players invent a new animal sound
Both players pantomime being in zero‑gravity
Current player becomes a human mirror for the other
Both players swap shoes and strut
examples.extra: Walk a 5‑step runway with exaggerated flair

examples.title: Both players do opposite actions for 30 seconds
Both players compose a 2‑line nonsense song together
examples.extra: Sing it while tip‑toeing in a circle

examples.title: Current player pretends to be a robot while the other is a translator
examples.extra: Switch roles and add sound effects

examples.title: Both players become inflatable tube people for 10 seconds
Both players act out a cooking show with invisible ingredients
Current player puppeteers the other's arms (gentle)
examples.extra: Switch roles and escalate the chaos slightly

examples.title: Both players mime being stuck in a doorway together
Both players pretend to be royalty greeting each other
examples.extra: Add a ridiculous bow and trumpet sounds

examples.title: Current player is 'wind'; the other is a wobbly tree
Both players translate each other's normal sentences into gibberish
examples.extra: Do one sentence very close together

examples.title: Both players freeze like statues in funny poses
Current player pretends to be a malfunctioning elevator; the other 'rides'
Both players walk like crabs toward each other
Both players mime being on a tiny boat in a storm
Current player is a DJ; the other dances like every genre at once
examples.extra: Swap roles and turn up the chaos

examples.title: Both players pretend to be magnets that flip between attract/repel
Both players conduct an orchestra of cat meows
examples.extra: Add dog barks for the finale

examples.title: Current player frames the other's face like a portrait photographer
Both players chant a made‑up anthem while spinning slowly
examples.extra: Pause nose‑to‑nose without touching for 2 seconds

examples.title: Both players perform a 'percussion massage' routine on each other's backs to a silly beat (over clothes)
Current player becomes 'gravity'; the other acts like a balloon
examples.extra: Switch and end floating cheek‑to‑cheek for 2 seconds

examples.title: Both players attempt to speak in rhyme for 10 seconds
examples.extra: Lean in and whisper the last rhyme

examples.title: Both players become 'mirror twins' and dance inches apart
examples.extra: Hold the final pose for a slow count of 5

examples.title: Current player tries to keep a straight face while the other does slapstick
Both players improvise a 5‑second soap opera scene
